message: Nothing is born from hate. I thought you knew that better than anyone.
Suddenly, the Beni-Shigures restraining me collapse.
I look around. Only Koujaku and I are standing.
I crouch over one of them and check for a pulse.
A sudden drowsiness overwhelms me. My legs feel like rubber.
My neck is burning. Reaching up with my hand, I feel a swollen bump, like some kind of bite.
All of the Beni-Shigures were touched by it too.
Did Ryuuhou's death trigger something in the people he was controlling?

So... tired...
A moment's loss of concentration will spell my collapse.
I force myself to stand and lift my head.
But what I see there... petrifies me.
Koujaku is staring at me, his bloody sword in hand. But his expression...
It's like he doesn't recognize me.
He charges at me, brandishing his blade.
Willing my body to move, I throw myself to the floor. Not a moment too soon. Something cleaves through the air above my head.
Koujaku readies his sword and charges me again.
I roll, avoiding the blow by a hair's breadth.
The tattoo has now reached Koujaku's face, the pattern growing more sinister as it spreads.
If I use Scrap, and Koujaku ends up like Mizuki...

name: タエ
message: "If you'd said the right words back there, you might have turned Mizuki back to normal."
If I had used my power properly, I might have been able to save him.
No time for doubt. I have no other options.
I look straight into Koujaku's eyes.
Don't think about what might go wrong. I have to see this through.
I repeat the words in my head.
As Koujaku charges, I run straight at him―and dive into his chest.
His sword grazes the tips of my hair.
Ignoring the pain, I stare into Koujaku's blank white eyes and focus my mind.
